title: ICE when attempting to borrow non-existent item associated with type for argument
body:
The following code generates an internal compiler error:

``` rust
struct Mozilla;

fn some_function(c: &Mozilla) {}

fn main() {
    some_function(&Mozilla::PHANTOM);
}
```

As far as I can tell:
- One must be attempting to borrow (`&`) the value
- It must be a non-existent name associated with some type (as opposed to a name not associated with any type, i.e. `PHANTOM` instead of `Mozilla::PHANTOM`)
- It must be in an argument list of some sort. Take the argument out of the function call and there's no ICE.
## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
rustc 1.1.0 (35ceea399 2015-06-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 35ceea3997c79a3b7562e89b462ab76af5b86b22
commit-date: 2015-06-19
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.1.0
```
